intro: Machaeranthera aquifolia, commonly known as the waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to moist, well-drained soils. Machaeranthera aquifolia is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, thriving in partial to full shade.
